title: 270+ Funny Gym & Exercise Quotes to Work Your Core with Laughter

steps.title: Read these gym quips for a gut-busting laugh (itâ€™s good for your core!).
steps.content: Read these gym quips for a gut-busting laugh (itâ€™s good for your core!). The gym is a place to do hard work, but that doesnâ€™t mean you have to be super serious while youâ€™re there. Here are some of the silliest and most relatable jokes and sayings about working out (or not) and why we like it (or not). â€œI got 99 problems, but I'm going to the gym to ignore all of them.â€ â€œI'm sorry for what I said during burpees.â€ â€œLife has its ups and downs. We call them squats.â€ â€œYou make my knees weak. Just kidding. Yesterday was leg day.â€ â€œMy favorite machine at the gym is the television.â€ â€œIt's my workout. I can cry if I want to.â€ â€œI go to the gym because I think my great personality could use a banging body.â€ â€œIâ€™m not sweating, Iâ€™m leaking awesome.â€ â€œI go to the gym because punching people is frowned upon.â€ â€œI do yoga to burn off the crazy.â€ â€œGoing to the gym is like going to the circus, minus the fun.â€ â€œI don't work out. I participate in extreme body motivational activities.â€ â€œI'm not getting fitter, I'm just becoming harder to kidnap.â€ â€œI'm not sweating, I'm just attempting to become a water feature.â€ â€œI don't need a six-pack, I have a keg.â€ â€œI don't need to work out; I get enough exercise from jumping to conclusions.â€ â€œToday's forecast? A 100% chance of shredding.â€ â€œI'm sweating like a sinner at church.â€ â€œI work out so I can drink beer.â€ â€œI'm only here so I can eat more later.â€ â€œWhy work out alone when you can complain with friends?â€ â€œBurpees arenâ€™t torture; theyâ€™re â€˜character building.â€™â€ â€œMuscles arenâ€™t built in a day; theyâ€™re built in the time it takes me to find my workout playlist.â€ â€œI didnâ€™t skip leg day, I just prioritized â€˜upper half dayâ€™.â€ â€œI donâ€™t want to look thin. I want to look like I could kick your butt.â€ â€œMy favorite exercise at the gym would probably be judging.â€ â€œAt the gym, Iâ€™m like a ninja. Youâ€™ll never see me there.â€ â€œI will never break up with my gym. We just seem to work out.â€ â€œRest day? Where is the rest muscle?â€ â€œMerry fitmas and a happy new rear.â€ â€œCalluses? You mean lifting trophies?â€ â€œI exercise because zombies will eat the slow ones first.â€ â€œWhen in doubt, squat it out.â€ â€œMy Apple Watch made me do it.â€ â€œMeet you at the barâ€¦bell.â€ â€œI'm in a good place right now. Not emotionally, I'm just at the gym.â€ â€œThe guy on the treadmill next to me didn't know we were racing. (I won.)â€ â€œGood things come to those who weight.â€ â€œI spend my time at the gym doing diddly squats.â€ â€œI must go. My gym needs me.â€ â€œEducation is important, but big biceps is importanter.â€ â€œI donâ€™t get why gyms have mirrors. I know what I look like. Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m there!â€ â€œI donâ€™t always go to the gym. But when I do, I make sure everyone on TikTok knows about it.â€ â€œDo more of what makes you happy. Unless itâ€™s burpees. Never do more burpees.â€ â€œMy favorite machine at the gym is the vending machine.â€ â€œBut the gym IS therapy.â€ â€œI sweat so I donâ€™t cryâ€”same emotional release, less judgment.â€ â€œGym? I thought you said gin.â€ â€œDear abs, I'm working on you. Please show up soon.â€ â€œThis workout brought to you by my emotional support water bottle.â€ â€œDemons go to the gym regularly to exorsize.â€ â€œI like working out, but yoga is a stretch for me.â€ â€œSome apples just have good cores.â€ â€œYou canâ€™t spell legendary without leg day.â€

steps.title: Try a short gym saying for a quick laugh (or catchphrase).
steps.content: Try a short gym saying for a quick laugh (or catchphrase). Looking for a witty motto to keep you motivated at the gym? Look no further. These concise words of wisdom perfectly sum up why we go to the gym and just canâ€™t stay away. â€œHustle for that muscle.â€ â€œSweat is just fat crying.â€ â€œStrong is the new beautiful.â€ â€œKeep your squats low and your standards high.â€ â€œDo it for the after selfie.â€ â€œIf you look cute after, you didnâ€™t work hard enough.â€ â€œSweat now, pizza later.â€ â€œLift heavy, laugh harder.â€ â€œSweat is just tears from the gym gods.â€ â€œI belong behind bars.â€ â€œTired and sore and back for more.â€ â€œEvery day Iâ€™m musclinâ€™.â€ â€œOn Fridays, we flex.â€ â€œSunâ€™s out, guns out.â€ â€œWalk in strong, crawl out stronger.â€ â€œGirls just wanna have guns.â€ â€œItâ€™s not going to lift itself.â€ â€œTGIFâ€”the grind includes Friday.â€ â€œNo ifs, just good butts.â€ â€œTalents: Gym.â€ â€œCrunch time is my favorite time.â€ â€œIâ€™m not a gym rat; Iâ€™m a gym unicorn.â€

steps.title: Laugh at these relatable linesâ€”it might just help you lose weight!
steps.content: Laugh at these relatable linesâ€”it might just help you lose weight! Laughing is a natural way to reduce stress , which makes it easier to take off a few pounds. But thatâ€™s not allâ€”some studies show that regular and frequent laughter can have a direct, positive impact on your weight and BMI! [1] X Research source So, here are some funny sayings about exercising, losing weight, and dieting to kickstart your workout chuckles. â€œMy favorite exercise is a cross between a lunge and a crunch... I call it lunch.â€ â€œI can't believe I forgot to go to the gym today. Thatâ€™s 6 years in a row now.â€ â€œIâ€™m not losing weight. Iâ€™m getting rid of it. I donâ€™t want it back.â€ â€œWork out that cake!â€ â€œHow do you get your steps in? I like long romantic walks to the fridge.â€ â€œI work out because I really, really like food.â€ â€œExercise? I thought you said extra fries.â€ â€œMy six-pack is protected by a layer of fat.â€ â€œOf course I work out. I lift donuts to my mouth every day.â€ â€œThe only running I do is from the fridge to the couch and back again.â€ â€œI don't have a six-pack, I have a party ball.â€ â€œI'm not out of shape, I'm just in a different shape.â€ â€œI'm in shape. Round is a shape.â€ â€œI ate healthily and exercised today. I better wake up skinny tomorrow.â€ â€œI go to the gym because my couch said I was getting too comfortable.â€ â€œI need to get in shape. If I were murdered right now, my chalk outline would be a circle.â€ â€œThe best abs exercise is five sets of stop eating so much.â€ â€œI'm not lazy, I'm on a â€˜restâ€™ day.â€ â€œI'm not sure what's more challenging: losing weight or convincing myself it's a good idea.â€ â€œI'm not lazy, I'm on energy-saving mode.â€

steps.title: These lighthearted quotes show that lifting isnâ€™t a hobbyâ€”itâ€™s a lifestyle.
steps.content: These lighthearted quotes show that lifting isnâ€™t a hobbyâ€”itâ€™s a lifestyle. If this sounds like you, then these funny sayings will have you doubled over with laughter! (Just make sure youâ€™re using proper form.) â€œI consider my refusal to go to the gym today as resistance training.â€ â€œLifting weights is my love language.â€ â€œHome is where the weights are.â€ â€œWeights before dates.â€ â€œFriends donâ€™t let friends skip leg day.â€ â€œLifting is my cardio.â€ â€œSquats? Lift, grunt, and pretend to know what Iâ€™m doing.â€ â€œRow, row, rowâ€¦ Thereâ€™s no boat, just keep rowing!â€ â€œNecromancers love a good deadlift.â€ â€œLifting dictionaries helps to add definition to your muscles.â€ â€œI donâ€™t pay rent. Iâ€™m squatting.â€

steps.title: These sayings will make you laugh 'til your abs are sore.
steps.content: These sayings will make you laugh 'til your abs are sore. Whether you run marathons or just around the block, these sayings and quips about cardio and endurance exercise are super relatable. If you canâ€™t work up the motivation to step on the treadmill, read through this list to remember youâ€™re not alone! â€œDoes running late count as cardio?â€ â€œWill run for tacos.â€ â€œMy idea of a workout is a good brisk sit.â€ â€œUnless you puke, faint, or die, keep going!â€ â€œMy doctor recently told me that jogging could add years to my life. I think he was right. I feel ten years older already.â€ â€œRun like you stole something.â€ â€œThe best high five is when the treadmill finally stops.â€ â€œRunning is my meditation, which means I meditate once a year for 10 minutes.â€ â€œCardio: the perfect reminder of my love-hate relationship with breathing.â€ â€œRunning on the treadmillâ€¦ because running outdoors involves more effort.â€ â€œThe most difficult thing about a marathon? Working it into every conversation for the next year.â€ â€œRunning a marathon takes balls. Other sports just play with them.â€ â€œI like all of the things about running, like eating carbs, being cheered on, and wearing comfortable shoes.â€ â€œThe hardest part of summer running is to stop sweating AFTER you shower.â€ â€œThey say good things take time, thatâ€™s why I run slow.â€ â€œThat awkward moment when youâ€™re wearing Nikeâ€¦ And you just canâ€™t do it.â€ â€œDonâ€™t be a jogger, theyâ€™re the oneâ€™s who find dead bodies.â€ [2] X Research source â€œIâ€™ve got 99 problems, so I went on a run to ignore them all.â€ â€œYou never realize how long a minute is until youâ€™ve run on treadmill.â€ â€œI plan on having such an epic run, Morgan Freeman should narrate it.â€ â€œRunning is not a hobby, itâ€™s a post-apocalyptic skill.â€ â€œI received hate mile at the gym today.â€

steps.title: Check out these funny quips about working with (or as) a personal trainer.
steps.content: Check out these funny quips about working with (or as) a personal trainer. Whether youâ€™re a PT who wants to keep your sessions lighthearted or a gym-goer wondering whether your trainer is trying to kill you, these funny sayings are sure to bring a smile to your face (between your gasps for air, of course): â€œI donâ€™t stop when Iâ€™m tired. I stop when Iâ€™m done. And by â€˜done,â€™ I mean when Iâ€™ve finished my post-workout snack.â€ â€œThey call it a personal trainer. I call it a personal terrorizer.â€ â€œSweat is just fat crying. Letâ€™s make it sob!â€ â€œExercise in the morningâ€¦ before your brain figures out what youâ€™re doing.â€ â€œRemember, if you lose motivation, chocolate is always at the finish line!â€ â€œThe only bad workout is the one you didnâ€™t doâ€¦ or the one where you forgot your headphones at home.â€ â€œYou are one workout away from a good mood. Two workouts away from feeling like a superhero. Three workouts away from considering opening your own gym.â€ â€œThe word â€˜aerobicsâ€™ came about when the gym instructors got together and said, â€˜If weâ€™re going to charge $10 an hour, we canâ€™t call it jumping up and down.â€ â€œIâ€™d like to thank my personal trainer for the muscles. And my pizza delivery guy for the motivation.â€ â€œIâ€™ve got 99 problems, and they all involve carbs.â€ â€œIâ€™m a physical therapist. I solve problems you didnâ€™t know you had in ways you canâ€™t understand.â€ â€œDoing my best impression of a pretzel at physical therapy.â€ â€œPhysical therapists have their patientsâ€™ backsâ€¦ and necks, and knees, and hips.â€ â€œPhysical therapy: because sometimes â€˜walk it offâ€™ just isnâ€™t going to cut it.â€ â€œPhysical therapy motto: They poked me, they prodded me, and then they had the nerve to call it â€˜therapeutic touch.â€™â€ â€œWhen your trainer says â€˜last set,â€™ they really mean three more.â€ â€œI would have quit already, but my trainer scares me.â€ â€œOur session was whey better than I expected.â€

steps.title: Hype yourself up for a new PR with a braggy, punny quip.
steps.content: Hype yourself up for a new PR with a braggy, punny quip. You work hard at the gym, so why not make a cheesy joke about your progress? Thereâ€™s so much more humor to be had than a clichÃ© saying about the â€œgun showâ€ (although weâ€™ve obviously got a few of those lines hereâ€”how can you not?). Next time youâ€™re looking to gloat a little, pull out one of these: â€œI hope nobody calls the cops on me for walking around with these massive guns.â€ â€œThis used to be a normal t-shirt, but I'm so cut that the sleeves fell off.â€ â€œSomeone call the cops, â€˜cause I just killed this workout.â€ â€œMy arms are so jelly theyâ€™re turning green.â€ â€œIâ€™m like a water truckâ€”so pumped.â€ â€œAin't no mice on my shoulders, too many traps!â€ â€œNo curl, no girl.â€ â€œTSA stopped me and told me I have to check these guns.â€ â€œI need a forklift to pick me up â€˜cause I'm stacked.â€ â€œI hope the gymâ€™s empty, can't have anyone in my whey.â€ â€œI think I'm allergic to iron, I'm getting all swole.â€ â€œGonna have to get some permits for these guns.â€ â€œLeg curls? You mean smoking these hams?â€ â€œCall me Tony Stark because all I do is pump iron.â€ â€œThis fisherman went to the gym to find some muscles!â€ â€œAnyone got a bandage? â€˜Cause Iâ€™m cut!â€ â€œWorking on my abs is such a waist of time.â€

steps.title: Have a chuckle as you rack up with one of these gym quotes for women.
steps.content: Have a chuckle as you rack up with one of these gym quotes for women. Itâ€™s no secret that women have a different experience at the gym than men. Societal pressure to be thin leads some to believe the myth that lifting weights will just make you look bulky (and that â€œbulkyâ€ is undesirableâ€”itâ€™s not!). Plus, women have a harder time getting to the gym than most men due to obstacles like finding childcare or managing the household. [3] X Research source So, if youâ€™re a weight-lifting baddie or a cardio superstar who hits the gym despite the struggles, these funny (and motivational) sayings are for you! â€œStrong women lift each other and weights.â€ [4] X Research source â€œSweat like a pig, look like a fox.â€ â€œDear stress, let's break up. I found someone else... It's called the gym.â€ â€œStrong is the new sexy.â€ â€œI work out because I know I would've been the first to die in the Hunger Games.â€ â€œThis body wasn't made in a day; it's a work in progress.â€ â€œSweating out my insecurities.â€ â€œI don't sweat; I sparkle.â€ â€œI do it for the â€˜OMG, you look amazing!â€™â€ â€œGym hair, don't care.â€ â€œSorry, I can't. I have a date with the gym.â€ â€œStrong women don't have attitudes; they have standards.â€ â€œWork hard, play hard, squat harder.â€ â€œI didn't come here to look like a superhero, I came here to look like a hot mess who's trying.â€ â€œRun like thereâ€™s a hot guy in front of you and a creepy one behind you.â€ â€œWho needs makeup? Iâ€™m going for the post-gym glow.â€ â€œDonâ€™t train to be skinny. Train to be a bad*ss.â€ â€” Demi Lovato

steps.title: Share your love for the gym online with a cheeky fitness caption.
steps.content: Share your love for the gym online with a cheeky fitness caption. Whether youâ€™re trying to grow your fitness business online or simply flex for your followers, try one of these snappy captions to boost your engagement . When it comes to Insta or TikTok captions, keeping it concise and memorable is key. As social media expert Kasey Dunn puts it, â€œif it's not catchy, it'll be hard to keep [your followers] intrigued. You really want to captivate [your] audience.â€ â€œSweat is just fat crying tears of joy ğŸ˜‚â€ [5] X Research source â€œFitness? More like fitspo-tential.â€ â€œGym hair, donâ€™t care.â€ â€œGym and donuts, balance ğŸ©â€ â€œI didnâ€™t choose the gym life, the gym life chose me.â€ â€œI sweat glitter, obviously âœ¨â€ â€œSore today, strong tomorrow.â€ â€œThe only lift I need is a refill on my coffee â˜•â€ â€œGym and Netflix, thatâ€™s my idea of balance.â€ â€œI lift, therefore I brunch.â€ â€œWhen in doubt, squat it out.â€ â€œWill lift weights for donuts.â€ â€œThe gym is just my second homeâ€¦ with better lighting.â€ â€œSweat is just your fat cells crying for a better life.â€ â€œGym clothes, wine, and a good sweat. Thatâ€™s my happy place.â€ â€œIâ€™m not lazy, Iâ€™m just conserving energy for my workout.â€ â€œFitness is my hobby, pizza is my guilty pleasure ğŸ•â€ â€œGym and tonic â€“ the perfect combination.â€ â€œI work out to justify my Netflix binge-watching.â€ â€œGym hair, donâ€™t care â€“ unless itâ€™s a date night. ğŸ’‡â€ â€œI lift weights because I canâ€™t lift cars. Yet.â€ â€œWhen in doubt, squat it out.â€ â€œSweat is my signature, laughter is my accessory.â€ â€œI work out to balance out my wine and cheese intake ğŸ·ğŸ§€ğŸ‹ï¸â€ â€œMy body is a temple, and the gym is my sanctuary.â€ â€œFit, but still a fan of napping and pizza.â€

steps.title: Need some good old inspiration to get back to the gym? Look no further!
steps.content: Need some good old inspiration to get back to the gym? Look no further! We all feel a little burnt out at some point. If you need a good quote to give you a kick in the pants , check out this list from pro athletes, trainers, and thinkers about fitness, motivation, and pushing yourself beyond what you thought was possible. You got this! â€œNothing will work unless you do.â€ â€” Maya Angelou [6] X Research source â€œThere comes a certain point in life when you have to stop blaming other people for how you feel or the misfortunes in your life. You can't go through life obsessing about what might have been.â€ â€” Hugh Jackman â€œI've missed more than 9,000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. Twenty-six times, I've been trusted to take the game-winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.â€ â€” Michael Jordan â€œOur greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising every time we fall.â€ â€” Confucius â€œStrength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.â€ â€” Mahatma Gandhi â€œAbility is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.â€ â€” Lou Holtz â€œIncreased physical activity enhances positive energy.â€ â€” Lailah Gifty Akita â€œBelieve in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know and capable of more than you imagine.â€ â€” Roy T. Bennett â€œDon't count the days; make the days count.â€ â€” Muhammad Ali â€œThose who think they have not time for bodily exercise will sooner or later have to find time for illness.â€ â€” Edward Stanley â€œDo what you have to do until you can do what you want to do.â€ â€” Oprah Winfrey â€œIt's going to be a journey. It's not a sprint to get in shape.â€ â€” Kerri Walsh Jennings â€œPain is temporary. Quitting lasts forever.â€ â€” Lance Armstrong â€œNo matter how many mistakes you make or how slow you progress, you are still way ahead of everyone who isn't trying.â€ â€” Tony Robbins â€œGetting fit is all about mind over matter. I don't mind, so it doesn't matter.â€ â€” Adam Hargreaves â€œJust believe in yourself. Even if you don't, pretend that you do and, and some point, you will.â€ â€” Venus Williams â€œThe more you sweat in training, the less you bleed in combat.â€ â€” Richard Marcinko â€œAll great achievements require time.â€ â€” Maya Angelou â€œWe cannot start over. But we can begin now and make a new ending.â€ â€” Zig Ziglar â€œYou dream. You plan. You reach. There will be obstacles. There will be doubters. There will be mistakes. But with hard work, with belief, with confidence and trust in yourself and those around you, there are no limits.â€ â€” Michael Phelps â€œNothing is impossible; the word itself says â€˜I'm possible!â€™â€ â€” Audrey Hepburn â€œIf you give up at the first sign of struggle, you're really not ready to be successful.â€ â€” Kevin Hart â€œFall seven times, stand up eight.â€ â€” Japanese Proverb â€œYou have to push past your perceived limits, push past that point you thought was as far as you can go.â€ â€” Drew Brees â€œI feel an endless need to learn, to improve, to evolveâ€”not only to please the coach and the fansâ€”but also to feel satisfied with myself.â€ â€” Cristiano Ronaldo â€œWhen you have a clear vision of your goal, it's easier to take the first step toward it.â€ â€” L.L. Cool J. â€œI was never a natural athlete, but I paid my dues in sweat and concentration, and took the time necessary to learn karate and became a world champion.â€ â€” Chuck Norris â€œIf you ain't pissed off for greatness, that just means you're okay with being mediocre.â€ â€” Ray Lewis â€œDon't limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.â€ â€” Jerry Dunn â€œYou don't have to be good at it; you just have to do it.â€ â€” Karine Candice Kong â€œWhen you hit failure, your workout has just begun.â€ â€” Ronnie Coleman â€œObstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.â€ â€” Henry Ford â€œYou miss 100 percent of the shots you don't take.â€ â€” Wayne Gretzky â€œEveryone's dream can come true if you just stick to it and work hard.â€ â€” Serena Williams â€œI train to be the best in the world on my worst day.â€ â€” Ronda Rousey â€œThe deadlift also serves as a way to train the mind to do things that are hard.â€ â€” Mark Rippetoe â€œTo enjoy the glow of good health, you must exercise.â€ â€” Gene Tunney â€œEvery champion was once a contender that refused to give up.â€ â€” Sylvester Stallone â€œYour current body is the only body that can take you to your new bodyâ€”so be kind to it.â€ â€” Elaine Moran â€œFitness is not about being better than someone else. It's about being better than you used to be.â€ â€” Khloe Kardashian â€œBlood, sweat, and respect. First two you give. Last one you earn.â€ â€” The Rock â€œExercise is king. Nutrition is queen. Put them together, and you've got a kingdom.â€ â€” Jack LaLanne â€œThe muscle and the mind must become one. One without the other is zero.â€ â€” Lee Haney â€œIf it doesn't challenge you, it won't change you.â€ â€” Fred Devito â€œLiving a healthy lifestyle will only deprive you of poor health, lethargy and fat.â€ â€” Jill Johnson â€œYou've survived 100 percent of your worst days.â€ â€” Robin Arzon â€œThe vision of a champion is bent over, drenched in sweat, at the point of exhaustion, when nobody else is looking.â€ â€” Mia Hamm â€œThe difference between try and triumph is a little â€˜umph.â€™â€ â€” Marvin Phillips â€œAcknowledge the fear and do it anyway.â€ â€” Emma Lovewell â€œDon't dream of winning. Train for it!â€ â€” Mo Farah
